basics.name: David England
basics.label: Applied Mathematician | Atmospheric Scientist | Scientific Computing & ML
basics.summary: Applied mathematician and atmospheric scientist with deep experience in boundary-layer physics, numerical modeling, and data-driven methods. Background spans academic research, government and industry R&D, and full-stack software development. Specialized in stable atmospheric boundary layers, turbulence parameterizations, Richardson number dynamics, and bias-aware modeling. Strong interest in combining physical theory with modern statistical and machine-learning approaches.

work.summary: Research and development in atmospheric boundary-layer physics, numerical modeling, and data-driven parameterizations.
highlights: Developed analytic and semi-analytic stability functions for the stable atmospheric boundary layer
Explored Richardson-number curvature corrections and MOST extensions
Designed bias-aware surrogate models bridging physical theory and machine learning
Scientific computing in Python, Julia, and JavaScript

work.summary: Taught Learning Support Math, Developmental Studies, Algebra, and Statistics.
highlights: ITT Technical Institute â€“ Madison, Alabama
PHP, JavaScript, jQuery, plugins, and site administration

work.summary: Equipment operator, mechanic, and livestock wrangler
Construction, shipping, and setup of IHSN franchises manufacturing Structurally Insulated Panels (SIPs). Built and assembled SIP-based housing.

highlights: Troubleshot computers and resolved network issues

work.summary: Investigated degradation of high-frequency radio transmissions due to weather events.
Extracted and analyzed NASA and NOAA climate datasets to improve climate models.
Simulated ozone transport for TVA. Developed atmospheric numerical models and authored papers and proposals.

work.company: The University of Alabama in Huntsville
work.summary: Taught calculus and differential equations. Conducted atmospheric modeling research and proposal writing.
Designed experiments for ASAT near-miss determination and provided intelligence support during the First Gulf War.

education.summary: Dissertation: A Mathematical Analysis of Nocturnal Slope Flows.
Calibrated pyronometers for NASA; launched weather balloons; developed numerical weather and climate models; taught mathematics.

education.area: Mathematics, Computer Science, Statistics, and Physics
education.summary: Worked in computer lab and media center.
